meta.content: UPDATED INFORMATION REGARDING BBPS CLOSURE AND OFF CAMPUS LEARNING - April 9, 2020 - Broken Bow Public Schools

Graduation is tentatively set for August 8th at 2:00pm. Please click on the link below for the updated information regarding off-campus learning times for students to come and pick up items from school and other pertinent school news. Also, don’t forget to tune into the Tobey Talk Show Live on Tuesdays and Thursdays at noon...

a.title: UPDATED INFORMATION REGARDING BBPS CLOSURE AND OFF CAMPUS LEARNING — April 9, 2020

img.title: UPDATED INFORMATION REGARDING BBPS CLOSURE AND OFF CAMPUS LEARNING — April 9, 2020

header.h2: UPDATED INFORMATION REGARDING BBPS CLOSURE AND OFF CAMPUS LEARNING — April 9, 2020

div.p: Graduation is tentatively set for August 8th at 2:00pm.

Please click on the link below for the updated information regarding off-campus learning times for students to come and pick up items from school and other pertinent school news. Also, don’t forget to tune into the Tobey Talk Show Live on Tuesdays and Thursdays at noon on Facebook Live.

p.strong: The links below are specific to North Park Elementary regarding off campus learning homework requirements and teacher office hours.

p.a: North Park Elementary Homework Week of April 14th
North Park Elementary Homework Week of April 20th

p.strong: The MS/HS teachers will be available to students at the following times on Tuesdays and Thursdays through the end of the regularly scheduled school year:

div.p: You can email any of the teachers at any time, but these are the specific times set aside for them to be available.

NSAA UPDATE as of April 2, 2020:
All remaining NSAA activity practices and competitions, including district and state competitions, have been cancelled for this school year. These cancelations are part of a new Directed Health Measure issued by Governor Ricketts.
Bylaw 3.2.7 (Summer Activities) will go into effect on May 26th. In the interim, Bylaw 3.2.6.1 (School-Year, Out-of-Season) is expected to be followed by all member school athletic programs.
The NSAA continues to encourage all member schools to follow CDC, local, state and federal health department recommendations.
The May 1st Transfer List deadline remains unchanged.
Any further official updates will be posted on the NSAA website and the NSAA social media platforms.
You must be logged in to post a comment.
